projectManager.viewsWelcome.favorites.co:
No projects saved yet.
In order to save projects, you have to open a folder or workspace first.
[Open Folder](command:_projectManager.openFolderWelcome)
[Open Workspace from File](command:workbench.action.openWorkspace)
To learn more about how to use Project Manager in VS Code [read the docs](http://github.com/alefragnani/vscode-project-manager/#project-manager).

No projects saved yet.
In order to save the current folder/workspace as a project, execute the command:
[Project Manager: Save Project](command:projectManager.saveProject)
To learn more about how to use Project Manager in VS Code [read the docs](http://github.com/alefragnani/vscode-project-manager/#project-manager).
projectManager.viewsWelcome.git.contents:
No projects detected.
In order to detect Git projects, you have to configure the `baseFolders` where the Git projects are.
[Open Settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%5B%22projectManager.git.baseFolders%22%5D)
[I don't need Git projects](command:projectManager.hideGitWelcome)
It also supports detection of SVN or Mercurial repositories, VS Code or any other folder.
To learn more about how to use Project Manager in VS Code [read the docs](https://github.com/alefragnani/vscode-project-manager/#available-settings).
projectManager.commands.listProjects.tit: Project Manager: List Projects to Open

projectManager.commands.filterProjectsBy: Project Manager: Filter Projects by Tag

projectManager.configuration.title: Project Manager
projectManager.configuration.showProject: Should display the project name in the Status Bar?
projectManager.configuration.openInNewWi: Should the project be opened using a New Window when you click the Status Bar?
projectManager.configuration.removeCurre: Should the current project be hidden in the list of available projects?
projectManager.configuration.sortList.de: List the projects sorted by...(Saved, Name, Path or Recent)
projectManager.configuration.groupList.d: List the projects grouped by...(Favorites, VSCode, Git, Mercurial and SVN)
projectManager.configuration.projectsLoc: Indicates an alternative location (folder path) where the `projects.json` file is stored
projectManager.configuration.vscode.base: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to search for VSCode projects
projectManager.configuration.vscode.igno: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to be ignored when searching for projects
projectManager.configuration.vscode.maxD: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
projectManager.configuration.git.baseFol: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to search for Git projects
projectManager.configuration.git.ignored: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to be ignored when searching for projects
projectManager.configuration.git.maxDept: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
projectManager.configuration.hg.baseFold: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to search for Mercurial projects
projectManager.configuration.hg.ignoredF: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to be ignored when searching for projects
projectManager.configuration.hg.maxDepth: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
projectManager.configuration.svn.baseFol: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to search for SVN projects
projectManager.configuration.svn.ignored: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to be ignored when searching for projects
projectManager.configuration.svn.maxDept: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
projectManager.configuration.any.baseFol: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to search for any folder projects
projectManager.configuration.any.ignored: Indicates folders or [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to be ignored when searching for projects
projectManager.configuration.any.exclude: Exclude the base folders themselves from the auto-detected projects list
projectManager.configuration.any.maxDept: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
projectManager.configuration.cacheProjec: Should cache the VSCode, Git and SVN projects found?
projectManager.configuration.ignoreProje: Should ignore projects found inside other projects?
projectManager.configuration.checkInvali: Should check for invalid paths before listing, showing a message below the project name?
projectManager.configuration.showParentF: Should show the parent folder info when projects with same name are detected?
projectManager.configuration.filterOnFul: Should filter projects through full path?
projectManager.configuration.openInCurre: Indicates if the New Window command open the project in current window, when empty.
Indicates if the New Window command open the project in current window, when empty.
projectManager.configuration.confirmSwit: Controls whether the extension should ask for confirmation when opening projects in the active window.
projectManager.configuration.tags.descri: Indicates the list of tags you can use to organize your projects
projectManager.configuration.tags.collap: Controls how tag groups in the Favorites view are expanded or collapsed by default, and whether their state is remembered.
Tag groups start expanded, but remember your last expand/collapse state.
Tag groups start collapsed, but remember your last expand/collapse state.
projectManager.colors.sideBar.currentPro: The color to highlight the current project in the Side Bar
projectManager.walkthroughs.title: Get Started with Project Manager
projectManager.walkthroughs.description: Learn more about Project Manager to optimize your workflow
projectManager.walkthroughs.saveYourFavo:
Easily acces your favorite projects, no matter where they are located.
__Don't miss those important projects anymore__
[Save Project](command:projectManager.saveProject)
projectManager.walkthroughs.autoDetectGi:
Define a set of base folders where your Git projects are located and the extension present you.
[Open Settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%5B%22projectManager.git.baseFolders%22%5D)

projectManager.walkthroughs.findAndOpenP.message:
Quickly access all your projects in the **Command Palette** and it its exclusive **Side Bar**.
[List Projects to Open](command:projectManager.listProjects)

projectManager.walkthroughs.organizeWith: You can organize/categorize your projects using **Tags**. Filter your projects by **Tags** and even choose active **Tags** that are more relevant to the work you are doing.
projectManager.walkthroughs.exclusiveSid:
An exclusive Side Bar with everything you need for great productivity.
[Open Side Bar](command:_projectManager.openSideBar)
projectManager.walkthroughs.workingWithR: The extension support [Remote Development](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/remote/remote-overview) scenarios, and you may choose how to use it, depending on your needs.
